instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had a fried SATA cable. Changed the cable and still no spin from drive.

L4500 - 5V
<CAPACITOR>C4510</CAPACITOR> - 1.1
<CAPACITOR>C4511</CAPACITOR> - 1.1
<CAPACITOR>C4534</CAPACITOR> - 0
<CAPACITOR>C4533</CAPACITOR> - 0
fl4501 - 0

<CHIP>U4510</CHIP>
pn 4 1V
pn 5 1V
pn 6 1.5V
pn16 1.5V

Thanks in advance for any insight.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: Did you measure on both sides of L4500? Was the cable damaged, these normally don't fail. I assume you tried with a known good HDD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: hi. yes. both sides L4500 are 5V's. the old cable smelled burned. The hard drive Im using boots to MacOS via USB. Also, and not sure if this is related yet. computer only starts up with battery. Will charge and stay running with magsafe. But will only boot with battery. Thanks for your response. Appreciate it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message:
You are not using an original 85W charger, but that will not affect the HDD of course.

Beep out the 4 SATA data lines from the HDD connector to <CAPACITOR>C4533</CAPACITOR>,34,35,36. Could be another bad cable or bad connector. Also check if 5V makes it to the HDD connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: Pins 1, 9, 10, 11, 12 all have 5v's. all 4 SATA lines seem to have  connectivity. 17 to <CAPACITOR>C4533</CAPACITOR>, 19 34, 18 to 36 and 20 to 35.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: l4500 looks kinda crappy. Tiny solder balls hanging off it, little burnt on the bottom near the board but it seams to be working fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: L4500 could be half fried and have resistance, it will drop voltage once it passes some current. Check with HDD connected if the voltage drops or just replace it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power to HDD
threads.message: Replaced L4500 this morning. HDD spins. Thank you for your help. Appreciate it.
